item.title: Are there any extra fees that I will have to pay on top of the listed price?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: No, we do not charge any extra fees or fuel surcharges. The listed price is the price you pay. Including tax.

item.title: What is your refund and cancellation policy?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: You must call 72 hours ahead of your scheduled tour for a full refund. Within 72 hours you will assess a $35 termination fee. There are no refunds for cancellations within 24 hours of your tour, or if you decide not to show up.

item.title: Are we going hiking even though its raining and windy?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We do hike in the rain, snow, wind and any other weather conditions that nature decides to throw at us. After all, were going on adventures! If the weather is unsafe for any reason, the trip will be changed or postponed. You will be notified the week of your trip if there are changes due to weather.

item.title: Should I print a receipt to show the tour guide?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We understand that you may not have a printer handy when you're traveling so it is not necessary to have a printed copy. However, we require that you show ID matching your reservation and also the Order # that is immediately emailed to you after you make your reservation.

item.title: How much does it cost to do a private tour?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Please contact us to get the latest information on your desired trip.

item.title: Do I have to make a reservation or can I just show up?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Yes. Reservations are required for guaranteed spots on all tours. Reservations help us determine the number of guides we need to ensure that our groups remain manageable and enjoyable, and they allow us to notify you of changes to the tour due to weather or anything that could disturb the tours.

item.title: What should I wear?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Wear whatever is comfortable. It is recommended to have a sturdy pair of broken-in trail shoes, boots, or sneakers. It is preferable to dress in layers and wear clothing that will wick away perspiration and keep you dry and comfortable

item.title: What do I need to bring?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Not much, remember our trips are all inclusive. We do suggest you bring appropriate clothing to fit the season and a day pack to carry extra snacks and water.

item.title: Alaska Cruise
